Yes, many famous movies were released during the Roaring Twenties. Some of the most popular films of the time include:

1. The Jazz Singer (1927) - The first feature-length film with synchronized sound, this movie stars Al Jolson and marked the beginning of the "talkie" era.

2. Metropolis (1927) - This German science fiction film directed by Fritz Lang is considered a landmark in cinema history with its innovative use of special effects and visual storytelling.

3. Sunrise: A Song of Two Humans (1927) - This silent film directed by F.W. Murnau won multiple Academy Awards and is considered one of the greatest films of all time.

4. The General (1926) - This silent comedy film directed by Buster Keaton is now hailed as a classic in American cinema.

5. The Kid (1921) - This silent film directed by Charlie Chaplin remains a favorite among many film lovers and critics.

These are just a few examples of the many iconic films released during the Roaring Twenties.
